intro: Restio perseverans, commonly known as the hardy restio, is a species of grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and grasses adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and compact, clustered growth habit. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Due to its resilience and ornamental appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as a drought-tolerant plant.
